H0.text: Respiration is the process during which plants use carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

H1.text: Fertilization is the process during which plants use carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

H2.text: Evaporation is the process during which plants use carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

H3.text: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants use carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

A4.text: Photosynthesis captures energy from sunlight to convert carbon dioxide into carbohydrates.

A5.text: Carbon dioxide is converted into sugars in a process called carbon fixation.
